item.title: Risotto raises $10M seed to use AI to make ticketing systems easier to use
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Designed to autonomously resolve help desk tickets, Risotto has raised $10 million in seed funding in a round led by Bonfire Ventures.

item.title: Samsung’s TriFold phone will cost $2,899 in the US
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The phone's display unfolds twice to reveal a 10-inch display, which is the largest screen ever on a Galaxy phone.

item.title: Phoebe Gates and Sophia Kianni’s Phia raises $35M to ‘make shopping fun again’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: “We’re on the cusp of a completely new way of shopping,” Gates told TechCrunch.

item.title: Airtable gets into the AI agent game with Superagent
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: SuperAgent is Airtable's first standalone product in its 13-year history, and signals both the company's ambitions and the reality of the current AI moment: every serious software player is racing to prove they can deliver on agents.

item.title: Pinterest to lay off 15% of staff to redirect resources to AI
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Pinterest says it's "reallocating resources to AI-focused roles and teams that drive AI adoption and execution" and "prioritizing AI‑powered products and capabilities."

item.title: Luminar receives a larger $33 million bid for its lidar business
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: A new leading bidder has appeared in the Luminar bankruptcy case: Redmond, Washington-based MicroVision, which beat out Quantum Computing Inc.'s bid by $5 million.

item.title: China’s Moonshot releases a new open-source model Kimi K2.5 and a coding agent
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The company said that the model was trained on 15 trillion mixed visual and text tokens.

item.title: Node-based design tool Flora raises $42M from Redpoint Ventures
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Flora's node-based design tool is being used by companies like Pentagram and Lionsgate.

item.title: Uber launches an ‘AV Labs’ division to gather driving data for robotaxi partners
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Uber is not developing its own robotaxis again; instead it plans to collect and offer data. It's a bet that more volume will help autonomous vehicle partners solve the weirdest edge cases.

item.title: Northwood Space secures a $100M Series B and a $50M Space Force contract
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: This is the El Segundo, California-based startup's second raise in less than a year.

item.title: ‘Among the worst we’ve seen’: report slams xAI’s Grok over child safety failures
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: “We assess a lot of AI chatbots at Common Sense Media, and they all have risks, but Grok is among the worst we’ve seen,” Robbie Torney of Common Sense Media said.

item.title: South Korea’s Edenlux set for U.S. debut of eye-strain wellness device
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: Edenlux builds wearable tech to protect and train your eyes, inspired by its founder’s personal vision recovery.

item.title: Qualcomm backs SpotDraft to scale on-device contract AI with valuation doubling toward $400M
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: SpotDraft now processes over 1 million contracts annually using its AI tool, with contract volumes up 173% year-over-year.

item.title: Google pays $68M to settle claims its voice assistant spied on users
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Google did not admit wrongdoing in the settlement of the class-action case, which accused the firm of "unlawful and intentional interception and recording of individuals’ confidential communications without their consent and subsequent unauthorized disclosure of those communications to third parties."

item.title: AI chip startup Ricursive hits $4B valuation two months after launch
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Ricursive joins Recursive and Unconventional AI in raising massive funds at multi-billion valuations out of the gate.

item.title: Meta to test premium subscriptions on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: In the coming months, Meta is going to explore a premium experience on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp that gives users access to special features and more control over how they share and connect, while keeping the core experiences free.

item.title: Some international attendees are skipping 2026 GDC due to safety fears and growing ICE presence
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Many members of the international games industry are skipping the 2026 Game Developers Conference because of the growing ICE presence and other concerns.

item.title: Vinod Khosla publicly disavows Keith Rabois’ comments on ICE shooting
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Unwavering Trump loyalist and VC Keith Rabois caused his colleague and his firm's founder to distance themselves from his comments on ICE.

item.title: YouTubers sue Snap for alleged copyright infringement in training its AI models
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The YouTubers claim Snap, like others, used AI datasets meant for research and academic use to train its AI models.

item.title: Here’s the tech powering ICE’s deportation crackdown
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai, Zack Whittaker
item.description: From phone spyware and facial recognition to phone unlocking technology and databases and more, this tech powers Trump's deportation machine.
